page.title: 02 Meall Bhanabhie: Climate
page.content: {What Weather!} The greatest part of the survey area, then, consists of high ground, rising from 16 metres, at the canal-side, to 327 metres, at the top of Meall Bhanabhie. The climate, while it cannot be considered unwholesome, is moist - the wind blowing off the sea for eight months of the year. This accounts for the almost incessant rains which prevail. The corrolary to this heavy precipitation is that extreme cold is very unusual - snow seldom lies for more than 24 hours. However, there is no truth to the rumour that the local people have webbed feet!
